Location & Hours

Valene L. Smith Museum of Anthropology
Meriam Library, Room 180
530-898-5397
anthromuseum@csuchico.edu

Museum Hours :

Academic Year
11 a.m – 3 p.m.
Tuesday–Saturday

Summer (June & July only)
11 a.m. - 3 p.m.
Tuesday–Saturday

More Contact Information

The museum is located in the Meriam Library complex, across from the main library entrance.

Stay On Top of Museum Events and Programs - Join the Museum Mailing List!(opens in new window)

“Overall, my favorite experience while in the program was helping with some of the exhibits. With every exhibit, I met and worked with talented people who taught me something new” ~ Graduate Student, Coral Doyle.

Love Museums? Here’s how to earn a Certificate or Masters Degree in Museum Studies at CSU, Chico

The Museum Studies program at CSU, Chico is one of the premiere hands-on museology programs in the United States. Museum Studies Courses Include:

  • Exhibit Research, Design, and Installation
  • Collections Management
  • Museum Education
  • Museum Administration

Learn About the Museum Studies Program

Sociology

We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.
